name: Alhambra
description: A palace and fortress complex located in Granada, Spain.
quote: Everything here appears calculated to inspire kind and happy feelings, for everything is delicate and beautiful.

name: Amundsen-Scott Research Station
description: A United States scientific research station at the Geographic South Pole.
quote: Antarctica has this mythic weight. It resides in the collective unconscious of so many people, and it makes this huge impact, just like outer space. It's like going to the moon.

name: Angkor Wat
description: A temple complex in Cambodia and the largest religious monument in the world.
quote: The temple is like no other building in the world. It has towers and decoration and all the refinements which the human genius can conceive of.

name: Apadana
description: An ancient audience hall in Persepolis, Iran, built by the Achaemenid kings.
quote: All the nations of the earth brought him tribute, the produce of the mountains and plains, as was due to the King.
quoteAuthor: Inscription on the tomb of Darius the Great

name: Big Ben
description: The nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster in London.
quote: To achieve great things, two things are needed: a plan, and not quite enough time.

name: Biosphère
description: A museum in Montreal dedicated to the environment, originally built as the American Pavilion for Expo 67.
quote: The biosphere is not just all the creatures that live in it, it's all the physical parts that they rely on too.

name: Bolshoi Theatre
description: A historic theatre in Moscow, Russia, designed principally for ballet and opera performances.
quote: Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and, instead of bleeding, he sings.

name: Broadway
description: A theater district in Midtown Manhattan in New York City, represents the highest level of commercial theater in the English-speaking world.
quote: Give my regards to Broadway, remember me to Herald Square. Tell all the gang at Forty-Second Street that I will soon be there.

name: Casa de Contratación
description: A government agency in Seville that controlled trade with Spanish colonies from 1503 to 1790.
quote: The House of Trade controlled the great wealth that Spanish galleons carried from the New World.

name: Chichen Itza
description: A large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya people in Mexico.
quote: The Maya were skillful astronomers, recording the movements of the sun, moon, Venus, and the stars.

name: Colosseum
description: An oval amphitheatre in the centre of Rome, Italy, the largest ever built.
quote: While stands the Coliseum, Rome shall stand; When falls the Coliseum, Rome shall fall; And when Rome falls - the world.

name: Colossus
description: A statue of the Greek titan-god of the sun Helios, erected in the city of Rhodes.
quote: Even as it fell broken at the feet of the Greeks, so are we left to wonder at the magnitude of erecting such a work.

name: Cristo Redentor
description: An Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
quote: Christ the Redeemer, with open arms, is always ready to receive and embrace anyone who comes to Him.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: A wrought-iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.
quote: I ought to be jealous of the tower. She is more famous than I am.

name: Estádio do Maracanã
description: A football stadium in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, one of the largest in the world.
quote: The roar of the crowd at the Maracanã is like no other sound in sport.

name: Etemenanki
description: A ziggurat dedicated to Marduk in the ancient city of Babylon, possibly the inspiration for the biblical Tower of Babel.
quote: Now the whole world had one language and a common speech. As people moved eastward, they found a plain in Shinar and settled there.

name: Forbidden City
description: A palace complex in central Beijing, China that served as the home of emperors.
quote: Out of this door might come a princess in a dress of golden silk, embroidered with dragons, or a band of swordsmen in leather coats and iron helmets.

name: Golden Gate Bridge
description: A suspension bridge spanning the Golden Gate strait in San Francisco, California.
quote: What a monument to the builders of our country—what a monument to their vision.

name: Great Bath
description: An ancient public water tank in the ruins of Mohenjo-daro in Sindh, Pakistan, part of the Indus Valley Civilization.
quote: Waters of purification, waters of power, waters of life, come, sanctify this person.

name: Great Library
description: One of the largest libraries of the ancient world, located in Alexandria, Egypt.
quote: Medicine heals the body, but wisdom relieves the soul.
quoteAuthor: Inscription over the door of the Library of Alexandria

name: Great Lighthouse
description: A lighthouse built by the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Ancient Egypt, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
quote: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters; these see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.

name: Great Zimbabwe
description: The ruins of an ancient city in Zimbabwe, built by the Shona civilization.
quote: And they built strong and comely houses of stone that today amaze all who behold them.

name: Hagia Sophia
description: A former Greek Orthodox Christian cathedral, later an Ottoman Imperial mosque, and now a museum in Istanbul, Turkey.
quote: I have surpassed thee, O Solomon!

name: Hanging Gardens
description: One of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, described as a remarkable feat of engineering with an ascending series of tiered gardens.
quote: The Hanging Gardens have plants cultivated above ground level, and the roots of the trees are embedded in an upper terrace rather than in the earth.

name: Hermitage
description: A museum of art and culture in Saint Petersburg, Russia, founded in 1764 by Empress Catherine the Great.
quote: Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.

name: Huey Teocalli
description: A temple in the main sacred precinct of the Aztec capital Tenochtitlan, now in modern Mexico City.
quote: The city has temples, especially that dedicated to their chief god, which are so spacious that they contain large plazas, where more than 10,000 persons dance and celebrate on feast days.

name: Jebel Barkal
description: A small mountain located on a large bend of the Nile River, in Sudan, considered sacred to the ancient Egyptians and Nubians.
quote: This pure mountain with its gleaming peak... which is very far from the sky, but whose name is near to the sky.

name: Kilwa Kisiwani
description: A medieval sultanate on an island off the coast of East Africa, in present-day Tanzania.
quote: One of the most beautiful and well-constructed towns in the world, where most houses are built of coral stone.

name: Kotoku-in
description: A Buddhist temple with the famous Great Buddha of Kamakura, a large bronze statue of Amida Buddha.
quote: When the visitor approaches the Great Buddha, he will be impressed at its colossal size, and feel its irresistible beauty.

name: Machu Picchu
description: A 15th-century Inca citadel set high in the Andes Mountains in Peru.
quote: Few romances can ever surpass that of the granite citadel on top of the beetling precipices of Machu Picchu.

name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
description: A tomb built between 353 and 350 BC at Halicarnassus (present-day Bodrum, Turkey) for Mausolus, a satrap in the Persian Empire.
quote: This monument shall be a testimony to the fame of all; for Halicarnassus and its glory shall never die.

name: Meenakshi Temple
description: A historic Hindu temple located in the city of Madurai, India, dedicated to Goddess Parvati and Lord Shiva.
quote: The beauty of the temple, the elaborate rituals, the throngs of pilgrims, the wafting smell of flowers—all these combine to create an atmosphere of enchantment.

name: Mont St. Michel
description: A tidal island and mainland commune in Normandy, France, featuring a medieval monastery.
quote: The abbey stands as one of the wonders of the Western world, a reminder of the Age of Faith when the monks raised their walls of granite to the glory of God.

name: Oracle
description: An ancient temple to Apollo at Delphi in Greece, home to a famous oracle who provided prophesies and guidance.
quote: The ancient Oracle said that I was the wisest of all the Greeks. It is because I alone, of all the Greeks, know that I know nothing.

name: Oxford University
description: A collegiate research university in Oxford, England, and the oldest university in the English-speaking world.
quote: The whole object of education is to develop the mind.

name: Panama Canal
description: An artificial waterway that connects the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans through Panama.
quote: The land was divided, the world was united.

name: Petra
description: A historical and archaeological city in southern Jordan known for its rock-cut architecture.
quote: A rose-red city half as old as time.

name: Potala Palace
description: A dzong fortress in Lhasa, Tibet, which was the winter palace of the Dalai Lamas.
quote: We had the sky, up there, all speckled with stars, and we used to lay on our backs and look up at them, and discuss about whether they was made, or only just happened.

name: Pyramids
description: Ancient monumental structures built in Egypt as tombs for the country's pharaohs.
quote: Except the Pyramids of Egypt, there is nothing in the world more wonderful to see.

name: Ruhr Valley
description: A major industrial region in western Germany, centered around the Ruhr River.
quote: Industry is the soul of England. We proceed slow in invention, but what we have once well invented, we execute well.

name: St. Basil's Cathedral
description: A church in Red Square in Moscow, Russia, built from 1555 to 1561 on orders from Ivan the Terrible.
quote: I have seen a most beautiful church: it is a veritable forest of colored cupolas spiring up into the sky.

name: Statue of Liberty
description: A colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor, a gift from France to the United States.
quote: Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free.

name: Statue of Zeus
description: A giant seated figure of Zeus, king of the Greek gods, at Olympia, was counted as one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
quote: One of the Seven Wonders; but it would have been less wonderful had they only shown Zeus, instead of Zeus and Olympia.

name: Stonehenge
description: A prehistoric monument consisting of a ring of standing stones in Wiltshire, England.
quote: Time crumbles things; everything grows old and is forgotten under the power of time.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: A multi-venue performing arts centre at Sydney Harbour in Sydney, Australia.
quote: The sun did not know how beautiful its light was until it was reflected off this building.

name: Taj Mahal
description: An ivory-white marble mausoleum on the south bank of the Yamuna river in the Indian city of Agra.
quote: Not a piece of architecture, as other buildings are, but the proud passion of an emperor's love wrought in living stones.

name: Temple of Artemis
description: A Greek temple dedicated to the goddess Artemis, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
quote: I have seen the walls and Hanging Gardens of ancient Babylon, the statue of Olympian Zeus, the Colossus of Rhodes, the mighty work of the high Pyramids and the tomb of Mausolus. But when I saw the temple at Ephesus rising to the clouds, all these other wonders were put in the shade.

name: Terracotta Army
description: A collection of terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang, the first Emperor of China.
quote: Behold the great terracotta warriors and horses: a magnificent work of art from more than 2,200 years ago.

name: Torre de Belém
description: A 16th-century fortification in Lisbon, Portugal, that served as a ceremonial gateway to the city.
quote: The Tower of Belém rises from the river like a monument to Portugal's great Age of Discovery.

name: University of Sankore
description: A higher educational institution in Timbuktu, Mali, one of the world's oldest universities.
quote: When a scholar dies in Africa, it is as if a library had burned down.

name: Venetian Arsenal
description: A complex of former shipyards and armories in Venice, Italy, where the Venetian Republic's naval power was built.
quote: Let the whole area be occupied by workshops and factories for everything useful to naval matters.

name: Országház
description: The Hungarian Parliament Building, also known as Országház, is the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary in Budapest.
quote: The Parliament of Budapest, one of the largest buildings of its kind in the world, is a symbol both of the Hungarian nation and its democracy.
